description: Implement Universal Document Standard (UDS) system that adds YAML headers/footers to all workorder-generated documents (plan.json, DELIVERABLES.md, context.json, analysis.json, claude.md) with workorder_id, feature_id, status, timestamps, and review dates
goal: Add structured YAML frontmatter metadata to all workorder documentation for tracking, lifecycle management, and traceability
requirements: UDS header template with YAML frontmatter (workorder_id, feature_id, status, timestamp, version, generated_by)
UDS footer template with metadata (generated_by, last_updated, review_date, AI assistance flag)
Helper functions in uds_helpers.py (generate_uds_header, generate_uds_footer, get_server_version)
Integration into all workorder generators (planning_generator.py, handoff_generator.py, tool_handlers.py)
Apply UDS to all workorder docs: plan.json, DELIVERABLES.md, context.json, analysis.json, claude.md
out_of_scope: Foundation docs (README.md, ARCHITECTURE.md, API.md, SCHEMA.md, COMPONENTS.md)
constraints: Backward compatible with existing workorder docs without UDS
Must use valid YAML frontmatter format
Only docs with workorder_id get UDS metadata
No breaking changes to existing workflows

functionality: All workorder docs include UDS YAML header with required fields
All workorder docs include UDS YAML footer with metadata
Helper functions generate valid YAML frontmatter
UDS templates exist in templates/uds/ directory
documentation: UDS templates documented with field descriptions
Integration guide for adding UDS to new workorder docs
CHANGELOG entry for v3.2.0 with UDS feature
